intro: Pinguicula caryophyllacea, commonly known as the Cape Town butterwort, is a carnivorous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is characterized by its rosette of succulent, sticky leaves that trap insects. The plant is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small, bilaterally symmetrical, and often pink or purple in color. Pinguicula caryophyllacea is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and requires minimal water once established.
